Instruction: Place the chicken breasts between two sheets of plastic wrap. Use a meat mallet or rolling pin to pound the chicken to an even thickness of about 1/4 inch. Season both sides of the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.
Place the all-purpose flour in a shallow dish. Dredge the seasoned chicken breasts in the flour, shaking off any excess.
In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of unsalted butter and 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken breasts to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side until golden brown and cooked through. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in the chicken broth and lemon juice, scraping the bottom of the skillet to loosen any browned bits.
Stir in the capers and remaining 2 tablespoons of unsalted butter. Let the sauce simmer for 2-3 minutes until slightly thickened.
Return the cooked chicken breasts to the skillet, spooning the sauce over them. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes to heat through.
Garnish the chicken piccata with chopped fresh parsley before serving. Serve hot with your favorite side dishes. Enjoy!
